poem:
### Digital Dawn

James taps the keys,  
finds classrooms in the ether,  
a school where walls dissolve,  
and faces flicker like flames.  
First, a shadow of doubt,  
then light—a new world unfolds.  
In pixelated corridors,  
learning dances freely,  
no bell to end the day,  
just the ringing of boundless,  
unseen skies.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How online schools are tackling barriers to education Moving to any new school can be daunting, but joining an online school is a whole new experience. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
